message.content:
cs.AI, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SY, cs.RO 

This paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) category because it presents a new algorithm for solving nonlinear PDDL+ planning problems using hybrid automata networks. It also involves reasoning about discrete abstractions of the HA network and posting conflict clauses to prune the SMT solver's search, which are common techniques used in AI planning. 

It could also belong to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) category because it involves instrumenting an SMT solver to solve reachability problems, which is a common task in programming language analysis and verification. 

The Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) category is also a possibility because the paper deals with reasoning about the semantics of hybrid automata networks, which is a topic that falls under the scope of mathematical logic. 

The Systems and Control (cs.SY) category is another possibility because hybrid automata are commonly used in control theory to model systems with both continuous and discrete dynamics. 

Finally, the Robotics (cs.RO) category is a possibility because hybrid automata are also used in robotics to model robot behavior and plan robot actions.
